paper_metadata.title: Evaluation of integrated livelihoods and nutrition programs in Bangladesh

program_information.program_name: DFID integrated livelihoods and nutrition programmes
program_information.target_population: Extremely poor households with pregnant and lactating women, adolescent girls, and children under five

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: assess the impact of the combined nutrition-specic and livelihoods interventions (L+N) across the three programmes on knowledge and practices of mothers and caregivers and the nutritional status of children under two years old
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: evaluation used quantitative and qualitative methods... e quantitative evaluation was undertaken at baseline (2013) and endline (2015) and qualitative evaluations were carried out at the beginning of 2014 and end of 2015

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: evaluation used quantitative and qualitative methods... qualitative evaluations were carried out at the beginning of 2014 and end of 2015

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: UK Department for International Development (DFID) aimed to improve nutrition outcomes for young children, pregnant and lactating women (PLW) and adolescent girls through the integration of nutrition-specic interventions into three existing livelihoods programmes
evidence_citations.country_citation: child undernutrition in Bangladesh has fallen over the last two decades
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: existing livelihoods programmes for extremely poor households in Bangladesh... targeting all PLW, adolescent girls and children under five years of age
